title: How to React During a Fire Drill at School

text: In The Classroom Keep looking at the clock in the room so you don't lose track of time and end up being surprised by the alarm if you know ahead of time.  When the fire alarm sounds, stand up and push your chair in. It's better to clear objects out of the way for the safety of others. As for belongings, leave them or in some situations take what you're already holding with you and keep moving. There isn't any time to be organized. Follow all the teacher's instructions and walk to the emergency meeting point. Stay together with peers. For your safety don't wander off by yourself. The teacher is likely to check that everyone has come out of the classroom. In The Bathroom If at that time you are caught up in the toilet, pull up your trousers, skirt etc. and run outside. It's better to evacuate immediately. Make sure you know your way around the school and run to the emergency meeting point. The teacher is most likely to check the bathroom for people anyway. At the meeting point The teacher will most likely do a roll call. Stay there in case they call your name. Wait until you're told to go back inside.
